videos.title: Staged releases on Android, redesigned Wear OS by Google, New in Chrome 69 | TL;DR 126
videos.description:
Staged releases on Android → http://bit.ly/2OlgiRV
Notifications on the redesigned Wear OS by Google → http://bit.ly/2xgQJKw
Open Match: matchmaking for games → http://bit.ly/2xdd1ge
RxFire: Easy async Firebase for all frameworks → http://bit.ly/2MvhJLS
Open sourcing the Firebase Android SDK → http://bit.ly/2OiVv1B
Tink cryptographic software library → http://bit.ly/2x6WUSo
New in Chrome 69 → http://bit.ly/2QsVVnj

The Google Developer News Show brings you the latest developer news from across Google. Your host for this week is Developer Advocate Jen Person (@ThatJenPerson)


Watch previous episodes → http://bit.ly/2KWNldh
Subscribe to Google Developers → http://bit.ly/googledevs

videos.title: Chat with Su Fu of Service Infrastructure Platform - Coffee with a Googler
videos.description:
Laurence chats with Su Fu, a software engineer of the Service Infrastructure team, to learn more about how Google’s foundational service platform can be utilized to manage your own API and publish your services. Su is also working on a Coding TensorFlow series to promote AI using TensorFlow framework. 

Learn more about Google Service Management API → https://bit.ly/2MiNJmt

Introduction to TensorFlow Lite → https://bit.ly/2xSBU4C

Watch more Coffee with a Googler → https://bit.ly/CoffeeWithAGoogler

Subscribe to the Google Developers channel → https://bit.ly/googledevs

videos.title: Implementing Report State for Google Assistant Smart Home Devices
videos.description:
In this video, learn how to implement report state for smart home devices with the Google Assistant. Nick Felker explains how to proactively report the state of your smart home devices to the home graph, giving users a faster experience on smart speakers and smart displays.

Reference Links:
Actions on Google Documentation →  https://bit.ly/2woGsM0
Github Sample Dashboard → https://bit.ly/2oicPZ4
Community Program →  https://bit.ly/2P7so14
Integrating Smart Home Devices with the Google Assistant video → https://bit.ly/2oLNzdT

Please subscribe for more updates →  https://bit.ly/googledevs

videos.title: Opacity - Flutter Widget of the Week
videos.description:
Have a widget that you'd like to be invisible but remain in the layout? Try the Opacity widget! Just give it an opacity value, and it'll fade its child to match. You can also use it to blend children of a Stack together, or animate a change with AnimatedOpacity. 

Learn more → http://bit.ly/2NogbrD
Get more tips! → http://bit.ly/2B8M3vG

Subscribe! → http://bit.ly/googledevs

This video is also subtitled in Chinese, Indonesian, French, Japanese, Korean, Portuguese, and Spanish.

videos.title: Sample Actions for the Google Assistant
videos.description:
The new sample Actions (https://bit.ly/2OKb9Tw) are the fastest and easiest way for you to create an Action for the Google Assistant, and to learn more about the powerful features of the platform. We automatically create a working agent in Dialogflow with full source code for the fulfillment, which you can then edit for your own Action on the Assistant. You get an Action that implements our best practices, that you can easily extend with other Actions on Google features. Within minutes, you can test them with the Actions Console simulator!

Learn more from the documentation at our developer site  → https://bit.ly/2OMAFrf
Join our Google+ Actions on Google Developers Community  →  https://bit.ly/2nJCtWr

For future updates, please subscribe → https://bit.ly/googledevs
